intro: Kadua affinis, commonly known as the common kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Kadua affinis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying Hawaiian flora.
